author: Staff Writer
title: Telkom looking to buy Cell C: report
text:
Bloomberg has reported that Telkom is considering a bid of $1 billion (around R13 billion) for Cell C, citing three people familiar with the matter.
“Investment banks are also approaching other potential bidders with the firepower to take on the deal, said two of the people, who asked not to be identified as the matter is private,” Bloomberg said.
This news follows two weeks after Cell C has had its corporate credit rating downgraded by S&P Global after missing an interest payment on its senior secured bonds.
Cell C is currently in the process of restructuring its debt in an acquisition deal involving Blue Label Telecoms and other shareholders.
Cell C spokesperson Karin Fourie said the Cell C recapitalization remains on track and is supported by the equity investors as well as the existing lenders to the business.
This is not the first time Telkom has expressed an interest in buying Cell C.
In November 2015 Telkom announced that it was in discussions with Cell C to acquire all shares in the telco group.
Shortly afterwards Telkom said it has terminated talks to acquire the full shareholding of Cell C from Oger Telecom.
The decision was a “mutual agreement” with Oger, Telkom said, following a period in which the telco conducted a due diligence on Cell C.
“Through Telkom’s engagement with Oger Telecoms in relation to Cell C, it has become clear that there is a difference between the parties on the assessment of value of the proposed transaction,” Telkom said at the time.
“As no agreement has been reached, Telkom and Oger Telecoms today agreed to end all discussions.”
